thread.title: Royals reliever breaks rib after falling through roof of barn
thread.title_full: Royals reliever breaks rib after falling through roof of barn

title: Royals reliever breaks rib after falling through roof of barn
text:
Manage Royals reliever breaks rib after falling through roof of barn This is not as weird as Trevor Bauer cutting his finger open playing with drone, but it's still pretty weird. 
The 2017 baseball season hasn't even started yet, but Kansas City Royals reliever Brian Flynn is already a strong contender for the most bizarre injury of the year. 
On the day before he departed for camp, reliever Brian Flynn crashed through the roof of his barn at his home in McAlester, Okla., breaking a rib and sustaining three non-displaced fractures in his vertebrae, Royals manager Ned Yost said on Tuesday. 
Flynn will miss close to eight weeks, Yost said. A 26-year-old left-hander, Flynn was expected to compete for a spot in the Royals’ bullpen this spring. 
“He was working on his barn and fell through the roof,” Yost said. “So he took a pretty good tumble, knocked himself out. So he’s going to be about eight weeks behind everybody else.” ESPN predicts 2017 MVP for every MLB team Start SlideShow 
After having cups of coffee with the Marlins in 2013 and 2014, Flynn made his major league debut with the Royals in 2016, throwing 55 1/3 innings with an ERA of 2.60, striking out 7.2 batters per nine innings and walking 3.7. He was drafted out of Wichita State University in the seventh round of the 2011 MLB June Amateur Draft by the Detroit Tigers. Author
